item.title: Computational Documents
item.description: Not all the documents that I create are computational â€” but when they are I use Emacs, Org Mode, and Babel Computational documents are a mixture of text and executable code. And the process of creating them, bringing together the text and code is called “weaving.” But sometimes, you want to separate the text and code. This is called “tangling.” For more see, extracting source code. This turns out that tangling is pretty useful when you want to maintain one source of code for display and for processing, maintaining the DRY principle
